#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Deal with a Car Maniac
#Text=How to Deal With a Car Maniac
#Text=We 've all dealt with them , or maybe you are one .
#Text=There are some people that eat , sleep , and breathe cars .
#Text=If you 're a normal person who is just content with their rust bucket car you bought off of a friends lawn , they may seem like strange people speaking a foreign language .
#Text=They just know what they like to talk about .
#Text=Even if you do n't understand why they must vacuum their car and detail it every week .
#Text=Here 's the scenario : Let 's say you have to go to school or work with a car maniac .
#Text=Instead of getting on topic this said person will not stop talking about his car , his baby .

#Text=Instead of cringing and telling him to go marry his car , stop and think . ( Sorry ladies but female car maniacs are very rare if they are , they are endangered creatures so this article will be mostly referring to car maniacs as men . )
#Text=If you are stuck with this person at school doing a group project or at work , you 're going to have to try to be civil .
#Text=You are going to be stuck with them .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Try asking them to get to work and on task politely .

#Text=We 've all had to deal with the two guys in the group that have the same interests and no matter what they do they have to debate about which type of cleaning product is good for their new dealership car .
#Text=How to protect it from UV ray damage and a bunch of other stuff that does n't seem relevant but it 's their whole life .
#Text=Try to feign interest and nod politely but then make it seem as though you just remembered we need to get back to work .
#Text=Try to laugh it off and be in good humor about it .
#Text=You 're trying not to hurt the car maniacs feelings .
#Text=After all , you still need to work together .
#Text=Sometimes this may not be the greatest way .
#Text=If the person you are trying to talk to does n't seem to get the hint you may have to be less subtle .
#Text=Sometimes it takes a lot more effort to deal with car maniacs .
#Text=If you 're caught in a never ending car story , which can happen to anyone .
#Text=You will need an escape route .
#Text=Try to distract the person .
#Text=If they will not stop talking keep looking away from them .
#Text=Try to give them a signal that you have other things to do .
#Text=Shift your weight in your chair and make it seem like you 're in a hurry .
#Text=Try to look at your phone and or watch if the situation gets really dire .
#Text=If all else fails try to say you have an important call to answer and fake answer your phone apologize , then walk away .
#Text=#Ask someone else who knows the person you 're talking about .
#Text=Mention to them how difficult it is for you to get through to that person .
#Text=Ask them if they have the same problem .
#Text=If there is no one to ask maybe a third parties prospective is all you need to shed light on this problem .
#Text=If you have n't been successful yet try to just talk it out with them directly .
#Text=If all these subtle hints do n't register with the car maniac try to talk with them about the problem .
#Text=Try to start the conversation in a light mannered way .
#Text=Just ask them if you could sit down and chat for a minute or maybe even get coffee .
#Text=Try to address the problem in an adult manner .
#Text=You do not want to create tension between the two of you , especially if you have to work together .
#Text=Just express your concerns over being on task and completing your work as a team , Try to let them down gently .
#Text=Say that you like them as a person but they make doing your work more difficult then it needs to be .
#Text=If you were on task things would go by more smoothly .
#Text=Express the fact you appreciate his interests but it 's irrelevant to the task you are doing now .
#Text=Example : " You know we would be on schedule if YOU were n't too busy talking about your car like it was your girlfriend .
